intro: Pedicularis lunaris, commonly known as the moonflower or lunar bellflower, is a striking alpine plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its pendulous, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often resembling a moon or lantern. Its leaves are typically oval and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Pedicularis lunaris thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in meadows and rocky slopes at high altitudes.
